snippet: As potential hosts see the Games as a costly liability, the I.O.C. faces a crisis.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Jules Boykoff calls for reconsideration of Olympic Games' relationship to cities that host them, noting that many cities have backed away from endeavor seen as costly liability; urges International Olympic Committee to address spiraling costs and ecological footprint, as well as issue of how Games could better serve host cities.
lead_paragraph: As potential hosts see the Games as a costly liability, the I.O.C. faces a crisis.

headline.seo: A Game-Changing Chance to Reform the Olympic Movement
headline.main: A Bid for a Better Olympics
headline.print_headline: A Bid for a Better Olympics
